DOC.brief_summary: Perinatal depression major public health problem , affect 15 % woman pregnancy postpartum period , adverse consequence mother , fetus , infant , family . Despite increase evidence importance critical risk interval , little research investigate effect depression treatment pregnancy infant outcome . The purpose study test feasibility , acceptability , effectiveness new intervention , Interpersonal psychotherapy mother-infant dyad ( IPT-Dyad ) . This intervention begin pregnancy continue mother infant one year postpartum . The investigator hypothesize IPT-Dyad well treatment usual reduce depressive symptom , improve psychosocial functioning , increase parent self-efficacy , improve infant emotional development , enhance mother-infant relationship quality .
